contradictions.description: Minimal work hours (4.0h/day) but low job satisfaction. May indicate underemployment or disengagement.
contradictions.explanation: Part-time hours with dissatisfaction suggests role mismatch, underutilization, or financial stress from insufficient work.
contradictions.recommendation: Clarify if this is desired part-time or forced underemployment. If latter, explore full-time opportunities or additional income streams.

recommendations.advice: Improve sleep: maintain consistent schedule, create bedtime routine, avoid screens 1h before bed, keep bedroom cool and dark, limit caffeine after 2pm
recommendations.rationale: Sleep is foundation of mental and physical health. Most adults need 7-9h for optimal functioning.

recommendations.advice: Address job dissatisfaction: identify specific dissatisfaction sources, discuss with manager, explore growth opportunities, consider career counseling
recommendations.rationale: Job dissatisfaction affects all life domains. Early intervention can prevent burnout or misguided career changes.

recommendations.advice: Increase activity: aim for 30min moderate exercise daily (brisk walk counts), take movement breaks every hour, use stairs, park farther away
recommendations.rationale: Regular exercise reduces stress, improves mood, and enhances cognitive function. Small changes compound over time.
